title: Bartholomew Roberts
summary: Bartholomew Roberts (17 May 1682 â€“ 10 February 1722), born John Roberts, was a Welsh pirate and the most successful pirate of the Golden Age of Piracy (measured by vessels captured),[1] taking over 400 prizes in his career.[2] Roberts raided ships off the Americas and the West African coast between 1719 and 1722; he is also noted for creating his own Pirate Code, and adopting an early variant of the Skull and Crossbones flag.
